title: Child's Gown, 17th century
medium:
Medium: linen, cotton
Technique: embroidery (satin, overcast cord, back, herringbone, laid work, coral, knot, buttonhole, and detached chain stiches)
dimensions:
H x W: 60 x 45 cm (23 5/8 x 17 11/16 in.)
width taken at hem
creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. DeWitt Clinton Cohen in memory of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: Dress or coat cut without fullness. Has opening from neck to bottom and long sleeves. Foundation 2 & 2 twill weave nearly covered with white linen embroidery (using satin, overcast cord, back, herringbone, laid work, coral, knot, buttonhole, and detached chain stitches) in design of flowers, leaves, and fruit worked solidly in ornamental stitches. Binche lace sewed in neck at bottom of sleeves and of dress.

tombstone.epitaph:
Child's Gown, 17th century. Medium: linen, cotton
Technique: embroidery (satin, overcast cord, back, herringbone, laid work, coral, knot, buttonhole, and detached chain stiches). Gift of Mr. and Mrs. DeWitt Clinton Cohen in memory of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1940-93-73.
